name: Feedr
description:
Feedr believe that healthy, fresh and affordable meals should be available at all workplaces for all employees. As a data-driven, online marketplace working with London’s top, artisan food producers, we are building software to connect them to employees in workplaces. 

We are building technology which can understand everyone’s food preferences and as a result construct relevant menus - getting them the right food, in the right place.  This is a ‘cloud canteen’ mentality - a scalable, individual way to eating great, healthy, high-quality food daily, and lunchtime will never be the same again! 

We are a VC backed start-up with world class investors and have grown 300% in the last 12 months, selling tens of thousands of meals each month - clients include the likes of AirBnB, PWC, DHL, Etsy and more. We are currently a team of 20 people and have recently been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list for the second year running.

team.name: Elizabeth Swanton
team.bioHtml: Fixing workplace food as COO @Feedr | MBA @London Business School | Formerly @Oliver Wyman @Clinton Health Access Initiative @CDC Group

perks.title: We're on the hunt for an office dog

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.description:
Feedr is looking for a mid-weight Full Stack Developer to join our growing team. The best candidates will thrive in a startup environment, have a passion for food and using technology to disrupt the current food/nutrition landscape, and be incredibly intellectually curious and willing to learn. We are a small, close-knit team where everyone is expected to challenge, question, and improve everything that we do to ultimately build the best possible product we can for our customers.

**Who are Feedr?**

Feedr builds workplace food programs for enterprises. We bring people together around healthy food, creating a wellness benefit around nutrition. Our technology can understand everyone’s food preferences and as a result construct relevant menus - getting them the right food, in the right place. This is a ‘cloud canteen’ mentality - a scalable, individual way to eating great, quality food daily.

We are a VC backed start-up (world class investors including those behind Transferwise, Nested, LoveFilm, Shazam & Carwow to name a few). We have grown 200% in the last 12 months with clients including the likes of AirBnB, PWC, DHL, Etsy and more. We are currently a team of 20 people and have been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list for the second year running.

**What we’re building**

We’re building consumer grade tech for enterprise. Our platform currently includes a consumer web and mobile app, an enterprise management web portal, a vendor portal for web and tablet, and a tablet-based kiosk app. As we scale, we are increasingly building a suite of software for multiple stakeholders and complex order management as well as a delightful consumer experience. We are also implementing a machine-learning based recommendation engine for our B2B and B2B2C products.

Our stack is React/React Native, Webpack, Babel, Jest, Node (Express), Postgres, Docker, AWS, Circle CI. We are open to candidates with experience in a diverse tech stack, as long as you have strong javascript experience.

**Role & Responsibilities:**

- Build and ship high-quality code as part of an agile team
- Continue building our suite of software for further B2B2C roll out and expansion into larger enterprise clients, including internal admin / operations tools, client admin tools, vendor platform, and client applications.
- Identity and implement opportunities to better integrate with workplace systems (e.g., slack), and other tools which can enhance our system (e.g., nutritional databases, logistics / routing tools, etc).
- Contribute ideas to improvement of the platform from a technology and product perspective.

**Requirements**

- Experience building great consumer and enterprise tech
- Minimum 3 years' full time, full-stack development experience
- Ability to work in remote as well as local teams (we are a partially in-office and partially remote team)
- Flexible, proactive, and happy in an environment where requirements change regularly and every decision is open to challenge.
- Confident in our technology stack and excited to learn new tools

**Benefits**

- Close knit team where everyone has the opportunity to challenge, question and improve what we do to ultimately build the best product possible for customers 
- Mission driven culture oriented around helping people live healthier and better lives. 
- Fast paced work environment where you never stop learning.
- Rapid progression and opportunity for high performers. 
- Convenient Central London office.
- Access to benefits including subsidised daily lunches (on Feedr’s Cloud Canteen platform), lots of food samples and the Headspace app to support mental wellbeing.
- Competitive compensation package.

jobs.title: VP Sales
jobs.description:
Following a large recent investment, we are looking to hire an experienced VP Sales to lead and build the current sales team and become part of Feedr’s exciting journey as we aim to 4x annual revenues in the next 2 years.

 

Reporting to the CEO, this is a new role and as VP Sales, you will be responsible for developing and executing on the strategic plan to achieve sales targets and rapidly expand our customer base.

 

We are looking for a passionate, influential and innovative leader with a keen eye for opportunity, a history of implementing innovative sales and retention strategies and a passion towards leveraging data, teamwork and cross-functional collaboration to achieve customer growth. You'll need great interpersonal skills, a demonstrable track record of excellent sales performance and a people-first approach to establishing team-oriented success.

 

**The Role**

- Lead and inspire a high performing B2B sales team, driving 4x growth in the next 2 years by building best in class sales and on-boarding strategies.
- Support and train the sales team to best manage relationships from first conversation to signing contracts. 
- Build and maintain strong relationships with enterprise prospects.
- Work with key prospects and customers to understand their business needs and objectives, designing the right Feedr solution for them.
- Ensure close collaboration with the account management team, sharing ideas for retention and revenue capture.
- Hire best in class talent to grow the team. 
- Maintain and improve sales team assets and processes, such as presentations, product collateral, pipeline management, sales playbook and retention strategies.
- Work closely with our marketing team to build a well functioning pipeline of leads which are targeted and scored in the right way. 
- Own and manage the CRM and reporting within the team. Ensure the CRM is being used consistently and measuring progress and performance on a weekly basis.
- Provide accurate and timely reporting to the founders, board and cross-functionally. 
- Drive a KPI and OKR influenced environment to ensure continued velocity and hunger for sales and growth across the team.
- Understand global landscapes and trends. Report on how prospect job titles, budgets, roadmaps and objectives are changing. Make recommendations for continually updating Feedr assets and products to provide the best market fit.
- Work with the product team to provide commercial feedback to improve Feedr products and build a future product roadmap

**Requirements**

- Proven enterprise sales leadership experience, meeting or exceeding targets, ideally in a B2B technology startup. 
- Demonstrable strategic thinking across sales and go-to-market strategies.
- Experience in fast-paced businesses where you have been part of launching new products or regions.
- Inspiring leadership of high-functioning teams of 5+ across business development. account management and senior sales.
- Proven ability to drive the sales process from lead generation to close.
- Strong collaboration and communication skills to work cross-functionally.
- Ability to communicate, present and influence all levels of prospects and key accounts including executive and C-level.

**Benefits**

- Opportunity to work closely with the founders to shape Feedr’s growth strategy and take advantage of exciting new enterprise opportunities.
- Mission driven culture oriented around helping people live healthier and better lives. 
- Fast paced work environment where you never stop learning.
- Close knit team where everyone has the opportunity to challenge, question and improve what we do to ultimately build the best product possible for customers 
- Rapid progression and opportunity for high performers. 
- Convenient Central London office.
- Access to benefits including subsidised daily lunches (on Feedr’s Cloud Canteen platform), lots of food samples, the Headspace app to support mental wellbeing.
- Competitive compensation package with significant performance based upside.

jobs.title: Performance Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
**About Feedr:**

Feedr is an online platform connecting offices to fresh, healthy meals from 100+ of the best artisan vendors in London. Feedr is redefining the workplace food landscape, using technology to build personalised menus and launch company lunch programs.

We’re fanatics about great food, great customer experience, and empowering people to have healthy, happy days at work. We believe that food should be transparent, well-sourced, and built to suit your personal needs and preferences, and we’re using technology to do just that.

Feedr has raised two rounds of capital, backed by world class angel and VC investors. We have grown 200% in the last 12 months and are currently selling tens of thousands of meals each month. Feedr has been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list for the past two years. We’re a mission driven team and looking for passionate people to join us in redefining workplace food.

**About the role:**

Feedr is looking for a passionate, enthusiastic and outgoing person to join our Marketing team. We are looking for a full time performance marketing manager to lead the team’s paid acquisition strategy to drive lead generation, further market penetration and brand awareness. Tasks will include but not be limited to the below:

- Lead and implement an innovative digital marketing strategy across Adwords, Bing, SEO, Facebook and LinkedIn paid strategies to drive lead generation.
- Develop and manage digital prospecting and remarketing campaigns for Google and Bing search, social and display channels..
- Day-to-day channel management including but not limited to: keyword research, ad-copy testing, optimisations and reporting.
- Budget management of all digital channels to drive strong return on investment and efficient CPLs.
- Produce metric driven reporting - must excel at campaign and channel reporting, including Google Analytics experience.
- Drive digital marketing innovation - build out A/B testing frameworks and mechanisms to test new channels, campaigns and products.
- Content and copywriting - confident at writing engaging and on brand ad-copy, across search, display and social channels. 
- Collaborate with the brand marketer for SEO
- Work closely with the Head of Marketing and Product Manager, on on-page optimisations and funnel conversion improvement ideas.

**Requirements**

Having already gained solid experience in a digital marketing role at a best in class tech company or startup, you are looking for an opportunity to take on more responsibility to drive forward the digital marketing strategy at a fast paced company, and feel confident supporting other areas of the marketing mix.

- Minimum 4 years of hands-on digital marketing experience at a best in class brand, preferably another B2B brand.
- In depth channel knowledge of Google Adwords, LinkedIn and Facebook Ads Manager - with a good balance of analytical and creative understanding of each of these platforms.
- A proven track record of managing successful Search and paid social strategies to drive positive business results.
- Highly analytical - very comfortable with raw data, and love continually making things better, with a strong working knowledge of Google Analytics.
- Also very creative - able to create new, imaginative ideas to explore and test, including creating strong ad-copy, and overall confident with the more creative aspects of digital marketing.
- Experience managing budgets and comfortable with quarterly, monthly and weekly budget setting.
- The ability to maintain a holistic and strategic overview while maintaining hawk-eyed granular attention to detail.
- Good understanding of the digital marketing landscape, and emerging platforms and technologies.
- Experience working with product marketing teams on funnel and onsite conversion journeys. Experience with platforms like Amplitude, Optimizely, Hotjar or others.
- Strong communication skills when working within a small marketing team and cross-functionally. 
- Proven ability to track and manage KPIs and ROIs effectively.
- Strong command of the English language, both written and spoken.

**Benefits**

- Opportunity to shape Feedr’s growth strategy focusing on digital marketing initiatives.
- Mission driven culture oriented around helping people live healthier and better lives. 
- Fast paced work environment where you never stop learning.
- Close knit team where everyone has the opportunity to challenge, question and improve what we do to ultimately build the best product possible for customers 
- Rapid progression and opportunity for high performers. 
- Convenient Central London office.
- Access to benefits including subsidised daily lunches (on Feedr’s Cloud Canteen platform), lots of food samples, the Headspace app to support mental wellbeing.

  • Strong communication skills when working within a small marketing team and cross-functionally.
  • Proven ability to track and manage KPIs and ROIs effectively.
  • Strong command of the English language, both written and spoken.

Benefits

  • Opportunity to shape Feedr’s growth strategy focusing on digital marketing initiatives.
  • Mission driven culture oriented around helping people live healthier and better lives.
  • Fast paced work environment where you never stop learning.
  • Close knit team where everyone has the opportunity to challenge, question and improve what we do to ultimately build the best product possible for customers
  • Rapid progression and opportunity for high performers.
  • Convenient Central London office.
  • Access to benefits including subsidised daily lunches (on Feedr’s Cloud Canteen platform), lots of food samples, the Headspace app to support mental wellbeing.

jobs.title: Sales Development Rep
jobs.description:
**About Feedr**

Feedr is an enterprise health platform transforming how employees access healthy food and better nutrition at work every day. Feedr is redefining the workplace food landscape, using technology to build personalised menus and launch company lunch programs.

 

We’re fanatics about great food, great customer experience, and empowering people to have healthy, happy days at work. We believe that food should be transparent, well-sourced, and built to suit your personal needs and preferences, and we’re using technology to do just that.

Feedr has raised two rounds of capital, backed by world-class angel and VC investors. We have grown 200% in the last 12 months and are currently selling tens of thousands of meals each month. Feedr has been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list for the past two years. We’re a mission-driven team and looking for passionate people to join us in redefining workplace food.

**About The Role**

Feedr is looking for a passionate, enthusiastic and outgoing person to join our Sales team. You’ll be a valuable member of the team, working to drive new lead generation, test sales messaging, refine our value proposition and more. You will work with the sales team to drive business, grow the sales pipeline and ensure the company's goals and targets are met.

The role will include:

- Drive a large quantity of high-quality outbound leads every day (primarily through emails campaigns) to our target customers.
- Source potential leads through Sales Navigator and online research, identifying target customer segments.
- Qualify new customers on the phone and help them with food recommendations and orders. 
- Identify key decision-makers in companies and reach out with highly researched, deeply personalized, and attention-grabbing messages.
- Grow far beyond the “standard SDR” role, including building playbooks to scale our sales outreach and help grow the business.  
Move relevant leads through the sales funnel, connecting them to a salesperson and assisting with closing that account.
- Support on building decks and other sales materials.
- Master our CRM system to maintain and report on activity and metrics.
- Collaborate extensively across the team and serve as a liaison between Sales, Customer Success, and Product.

**Requirements**

We look for raw talent and potential first - almost everything else can be learned quickly. Here are some of the attributes and skills we’re looking for in this role:

- You have a strong work ethic, are highly motivated and target driven. 
- You’re driven, intellectually curious and humble. You are always keen to keep learning. 
- You’re excited to work in a fast-paced environment. 
- You’re positive and love working in a team environment. 
- You’re open to giving and receiving feedback in a constructive way. 
- You have a strong desire to analyse data and identify target audiences.
- 6+ months of experience in sales development and lead generation. You know the foundations of sales/business development. 
- You have a passion for lead generation and prospecting. Experience using prospecting applications such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator is a plus.
- You’re tech and data-savvy and are comfortable working with a variety of systems, processes, including a CRM system. 
- You’re passionate about food tech and Feedr’s mission. 
- You’re organised with extreme attention to detail and the ability to manage your time effectively.
- You have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You can explain hard concepts in clear, concise language. 

**Benefits**

- Fast-paced work environment where you never stop learning.
- Room for rapid progression for high performers. 
- Mission-driven culture where enjoyment at work is core to our values.
- Investment in your personal and career development goals.
- Convenient Central London office.
- Lots of food perks including subsidised daily lunches and many samples.
- Access to the Headspace mental wellbeing app.
- Competitive compensation package.

  • Convenient Central London office.

  • Access to the Headspace mental wellbeing app.
  • Competitive compensation package.

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
We are looking for a driven, enthusiastic, results focused business analyst to be our first full-time data hire. Our ideal candidate is someone who is able to pull key insights from data and create actionable business plans. You must be comfortable working independently, and have enough experience to start to build this function out as part of our product and tech team.

**About Feedr:**

Feedr is an online platform connecting offices to fresh, healthy meals from 100+ of the best artisan vendors in London. Feedr is redefining the workplace food landscape, using technology to build personalised menus and launch company lunch programs.

We’re fanatics about great food, great customer experience, and empowering people to have healthy, happy days at work. We believe that food should be transparent, well-sourced, and built to suit your personal needs and preferences, and we’re using technology to do just that.

Feedr has raised two rounds of capital, backed by world class angel and VC investors. We have grown 200% in the last 12 months and are currently selling tens of thousands of meals each month. Feedr has been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list for the past two years. We’re a mission driven team and looking for passionate people to join us in redefining workplace food.

**Role**

- Drive actionable insights from data across the business. You need to be able to get under the skin of business and understand the how, what and why
- Own the tools for surfacing and visualising data across the company end to end from building data pipelines to client-ready dashboards and reports. 
- Define and answer key questions about our business. You will understand the drivers of success and help us answer how to attain them faster. 
- Work with all teams within the business to help them be self-service and answer their own data questions. We have a proactive team who owns their own data, and you will help them be more powerful with it. 
- Clearly communicate findings and important information and insights to business, including designing reports and/or dashboards for use by team and clients at various tiers
- Provide reports and analysis through tools, portals and databases (Power BI, Excel, SQL and/or other data management systems
- Support us in building reporting and marketing automation processes. Experience with event based data (Segment, Amplitude), Google Analytics & Google Tag Manager

**Requirements**

- A deep analytical mindset and desire to get to the root of the problem and solve complex challenges
- Proven experience with analytics and project management
- Excellent critical thinking skills, with very strong attention to detail. 
- Self-starter, ability to identify variables influencing growth and define models to forecast their evolution 
- Curious and always willing to learn new skills
- Strong people skills with excellent communication and presentation skills
- Excellent SQL and basic noSQL querying skills - we use Postgres and DocumentDB
- Experience with PowerBI is a plus - we use this to communicate client-ready dashboards directly to our customers. 
- BSc/BA (or above) in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

**Benefits**

- Opportunity to work directly in the data and product engine of a fast growth startup
- Mission driven culture oriented around helping people live healthier and better lives.
- Fast paced work environment where you never stop learning.
- Close knit team where everyone has the opportunity to challenge, question and improve what we do to ultimately build the best product possible for customers
- Convenient Central London office (currently remote working with lots of Zoom calls like everyone else - but plan is to return to office life!)
- Subsidised daily lunches (on Feedr’s Cloud Canteen platform) and lots of food samples in the office (currently subsidized home food delivery!)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a driven, enthusiastic, results focused business analyst to be our first full-time data hire. Our ideal candidate is someone who is able to pull key insights from data and create actionable business plans. You must be comfortable working independently, and have enough experience to start to build this function out as part of our product and tech team.

About Feedr:

Feedr is an online platform connecting offices to fresh, healthy meals from 100+ of the best artisan vendors in London. Feedr is redefining the workplace food landscape, using technology to build personalised menus and launch company lunch programs.

We’re fanatics about great food, great customer experience, and empowering people to have healthy, happy days at work. We believe that food should be transparent, well-sourced, and built to suit your personal needs and preferences, and we’re using technology to do just that.

Feedr has raised two rounds of capital, backed by world class angel and VC investors. We have grown 200% in the last 12 months and are currently selling tens of thousands of meals each month. Feedr has been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list for the past two years. We’re a mission driven team and looking for passionate people to join us in redefining workplace food.

Role

  • Drive actionable insights from data across the business. You need to be able to get under the skin of business and understand the how, what and why
  • Own the tools for surfacing and visualising data across the company end to end from building data pipelines to client-ready dashboards and reports.
  • Define and answer key questions about our business. You will understand the drivers of success and help us answer how to attain them faster.
  • Work with all teams within the business to help them be self-service and answer their own data questions. We have a proactive team who owns their own data, and you will help them be more powerful with it.
  • Clearly communicate findings and important information and insights to business, including designing reports and/or dashboards for use by team and clients at various tiers
  • Provide reports and analysis through tools, portals and databases (Power BI, Excel, SQL and/or other data management systems
  • Support us in building reporting and marketing automation processes. Experience with event based data (Segment, Amplitude), Google Analytics & Google Tag Manager

Requirements

  • A deep analytical mindset and desire to get to the root of the problem and solve complex challenges
  • Proven experience with analytics and project management
  • Excellent critical thinking skills, with very strong attention to detail.
  • Self-starter, ability to identify variables influencing growth and define models to forecast their evolution
  • Curious and always willing to learn new skills
  • Strong people skills with excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent SQL and basic noSQL querying skills - we use Postgres and DocumentDB
  • Experience with PowerBI is a plus - we use this to communicate client-ready dashboards directly to our customers.
  • BSc/BA (or above) in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

Benefits

  • Opportunity to work directly in the data and product engine of a fast growth startup
  • Mission driven culture oriented around helping people live healthier and better lives.
  • Fast paced work environment where you never stop learning.
  • Close knit team where everyone has the opportunity to challenge, question and improve what we do to ultimately build the best product possible for customers
  • Convenient Central London office (currently remote working with lots of Zoom calls like everyone else - but plan is to return to office life!)
  • Subsidised daily lunches (on Feedr’s Cloud Canteen platform) and lots of food samples in the office (currently subsidized home food delivery!)

jobs.title: Vendor Sales and Account Management Executive
jobs.description:
Feedr is looking for an ambitious, high performing foodie to be part of our Vendor team. You will be the face of Feedr to our restaurant partners, responsible for identifying and onboarding new vendors to join our community, managing existing vendor performance, and helping to drive our menu content strategy.

**Who we are**

At Feedr we share a powerful vision to help people access healthy, fresh and affordable meals every day. We are a data-driven, online marketplace working with London’s top, artisan food producers and are building software to connect great food to employees at work.

In short, we are building technology which can understand everyone’s food preferences and as a result construct relevant menus - getting them the right food, in the right place. This is a ‘cloud canteen’ mentality - a scalable, individual way to eating great, quality food daily.

We are a VC backed start-up (world class investors including those behind Transferwise, Nested, LoveFilm, Shazam & Carwow to name a few). We have grown 200% in the last 12 months with clients including the likes of AirBnB, PWC, DHL, Etsy and more . We are currently a team of 20 people and have recently been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list for the second year running.

**The Role**

- Grow, manage and retain our vendor base 
- Build close relationships with our vendors, acting as a partner to help grow our business profitably together
- Identify new vendors who would be ideal partners to Feedr, aligning with our brand and community, and sell them on joining as partners. 
- Find creative ways to solve vendor challenges, supporting them in training, operations improvement, and menu feedback. 
- Monitor vendor performance and meal ratings, reporting back to your vendor partners. 
- Gather key product input from vendors and work with product and development team to implement new feature
- Work closely with operations, account management, and customer service team to ensure an excellent all-round customer experience
- Collaborate with the Marketing team to promote our vendor community and develop unique content for our customers together with our vendor community 

**Requirements**

- Excellent verbal and written communication 
- An understanding of food and restaurant operations. Experience working in a kitchen, with food supply chains, or in operations are all relevant experience we are looking for. 
- Quantitative mindset, with good excel skills and basic understanding of common reporting tools 
- Excellent relationship builder, with proven ability to build and maintain customer relationships 
- 1-3 years' work experience in a relevant role. 
- Self-starter with the ability to manage projects from start to finish 
- Must love food! 

**Benefits**

- Opportunity to work directly with some of the most innovative food vendors in London and beyond
- Mission driven culture oriented around helping people live healthier and better lives.
- Fast paced work environment where you never stop learning.
- Close knit team where everyone has the opportunity to challenge, question and improve what we do to ultimately build the best product possible for customers
- Convenient Central London office (currently remote working with lots of Zoom calls like everyone else - but plan is to return to office life!)
- Subsidised daily lunches (on Feedr’s Cloud Canteen platform) and lots of food samples in the office (currently subsidized home food delivery!)
